title: 'Policy decision': US judge refuses to scrap Trump’s $100,000 H-1B visa fee
content: A US federal judge upheld the Trump administration's $100,000 fee on new H-1B visas, rejecting a lawsuit by the Chamber of Commerce. The judge ruled President Trump had the legal authority to impose the fee, citing concerns that the program was displacing American workers. This decision impacts tech companies and businesses relying on skilled foreign talent.

title: Bollywood celebs, Queen Elizabeth-2 cruise: YouTuber's Dubai wedding on ED watch
content: Unnao YouTuber Anurag Dwivedi, under ED scrutiny for alleged money laundering, hosted a lavish Dubai wedding for over 130 guests.  The extravagant celebrations, including flights, visas, and accommodation, occurred aboard the Queen Elizabeth-2 cruise. This opulent event has attracted significant public and official attention amidst the ongoing financial probe.

title: Ashes hangover? ECB probes England players' drinking after videos surface – watch
content: England's cricket chief Rob Key is investigating reports of excessive player drinking during the Ashes tour's mid-series break. Videos emerged showing Ben Duckett appearing disoriented and Jacob Bethell in a nightclub. While Key stated he expects responsible behavior, initial feedback suggests players were well-behaved, with only occasional drinks.  He emphasised that over-indulgence would be addressed.

title: West Karbi Anglong unrest: 2 dead, DGP & IGP among 50 cops hurt; internet services suspended
content: Two lives were lost in West Karbi Anglong as protests against alleged encroachment on forest land escalated into violent clashes with police. Hundreds of protesters, armed with crude weapons, attacked security forces, injuring many. The administration suspended mobile internet services to quell the unrest. Talks are scheduled to resolve the land dispute.

title: H-1B visa delay: Microsoft sends 600-word note; warns employees on travel
content: Microsoft has alerted H-1B/H-4 visa employees about significant appointment rescheduling and stamping delays at US consulates, particularly in Chennai and Hyderabad. New dates extend to June 2026, impacting travel plans. The company urges employees to return before current visas expire and has launched a survey to track the evolving situation.

title: Libya's military chief killed in Turkey plane crash; debris located near village
content: Libya's army chief, Lt Gen Mohamed Al-Haddad, and four others died in a plane crash returning from an official visit to Turkey. The Falcon 50 business jet lost contact shortly after departing Ankara, having declared an electrical emergency. Turkish authorities are investigating the tragic accident.

title: Pushed, beaten with log: 54-year-old teacher killed by husband in Bengaluru; staged it as accident
content: A 64-year-old electrician has been arrested for allegedly murdering his 54-year-old teacher-wife in Bengaluru. He reportedly pushed her off his motorcycle and beat her with a wooden log, then claimed she fell. Doctors' suspicions about her injuries led to his arrest and confession, citing financial disputes.

title: Salesforce reboots AI strategy: Model errors raise concerns
content: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, shifting focus to deterministic automation in its Agentforce product. Executives acknowledge a decline in trust in AI models, with reported instances of models omitting instructions and losing focus. This strategic pivot follows significant support staff reductions attributed to AI agent deployment.

title: Epstein files out: Trump referenced in some newly released docs; DOJ calls claims 'untrue'
content: The US Justice Department has unveiled nearly 30,000 additional documents concerning Jeffrey Epstein. These files mention President Trump, including an email detailing his flights on Epstein's private jet in the 1990s. The DOJ clarified that some claims against Trump are unsubstantiated and were submitted before the 2020 election, emphasizing their lack of credibility.

title: Dhurandhar: Ranveer Singh film nears Rs 1,000cr milestone
content: Spy thriller 'Dhurandhar' continues its phenomenal box office run, nearing Rs 900 crore worldwide. The Ranveer Singh starrer has achieved an unprecedented streak of 17 consecutive days with over Rs 20 crore collections, surpassing legendary films. Experts anticipate it will cross the Rs 1000 crore mark, a career first for Singh.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for December 24, 2025 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi's Mehul Kothari recommends CEAT, Endurance Technologies, and HPL Electric & Power for purchase. These stocks are showing signs of reversal and stabilization at key support levels, with favorable risk-reward ratios for potential upside moves within a 30-60 day timeframe.

title: Nvidia export workaround: Chinese tech major taps a ‘Japan route’
content: Chinese tech giant Tencent is circumventing US export restrictions on advanced semiconductors by partnering with Japanese firm Datasection. This collaboration allows Tencent to legally access thousands of Nvidia's high-performance Blackwell processors through Datasection's AI data centers, highlighting a significant loophole in US policy.

title: Uninvited guest: Lecturer quits job, turns full-time thief; how she robbed wedding guests
content: A former guest lecturer, Revathi, has been arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly stealing gold ornaments and cash from wedding functions by posing as a relative. Police recovered 262 grams of gold worth Rs 32 lakh after her arrest. She confessed to multiple thefts, citing financial pressures as her motive.

title: IND vs NZ: No Williamson! New Zealand announce squads for India series
content: New Zealand have named ODI and T20I squads for their India tour, using the series to prepare for the 2026 T20 World Cup. Mitchell Santner will captain the T20Is, with Michael Bracewell leading the ODIs. Several senior players return, young talents earn call-ups, and some stars are rested to manage workloads.

title: ‘Atrocities against minorities’: Jamia Millia Islamia suspends professor over exam question
content: Jamia Millia Islamia has suspended a professor and launched an inquiry following social media backlash over a semester exam question. The question, concerning 'Social Problems in India,' asked students to discuss 'atrocities against Muslim minorities in India.

title: Paul Rudd reacts to Travis Kelce’s apology after Chiefs’ playoff exit
content: Actor Paul Rudd shared his perspective on the Kansas City Chiefs' season. He highlighted the joy and memories the team has provided his family. Rudd embraced the team's elimination from playoff contention. He wished Patrick Mahomes a speedy recovery. Rudd also humorously suggested players deserved a break after a long season. He stated he was not too upset.

title: Who is Brittani? Inside Aaron Rodgers’ wife as marriage mystery deepens
content: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has found unexpected peace in his marriage to Brittani.  Unlike his previous public relationships, Brittani values privacy.  Rodgers credits his wife with providing unconditional love and stability.  This new chapter sees a calmer, more focused Rodgers as he navigates his final NFL years.  His teammates and coaches notice the positive change.

title: Shane McMahon and Marissa Mazzola’s combined net worth in 2025
content: Shane and Marissa Mazzola-McMahon possess a combined net worth of $650 million, largely attributed to Shane's decades with WWE and his diversified business ventures. While Shane's wealth stems from his executive roles, on-camera presence, and equity in WWE, Marissa's career in film production and PR augments their family fortune.

title: Jared Goff’s wife Christen shares how motherhood inspired home makeovers
content: Christen Goff is navigating motherhood by creating two distinct yet personal homes in Los Angeles and Michigan for her and daughter Romy.  She thoughtfully designs each space to reflect its location and their evolving family identity.  Despite the challenges of a newborn and dual residences, Christen finds joy and belonging in this new chapter.

title: Suspecting affair, quit job: Bengaluru-based techie shoots wife after receiving divorce notice
content: A harrowing event transpired in Bengaluru as a software developer allegedly took his estranged wife's life in broad daylight during rush hour. The victim, who worked as a bank assistant manager, was relocating home with their kids when the altercation erupted. The accused, 40 years old, subsequently surrendered to the police with the weapon.

title: YouTuber under ED lens flew over 130 guests for Dubai for his cruise wedding
content: A UP-based YouTube influencer, Anurag Dwivedi, facing ED money-laundering probes for alleged ties to illegal betting, reportedly spent crores on a lavish Dubai destination wedding for over 130 guests. The lavish affair aboard a cruise ship, including flights and luxury stays, has drawn significant official scrutiny. The ED has seized assets worth an estimated Rs 20 crore.

title: George Kittle injury update: 49ers TE speaks out as return timeline unclear
content: The San Francisco 49ers star player, George Kittle, suffered a brutal ankle injury at the match against the Indianapolis Colts. This has sparked chaos and panic among fans as his return timeline remains unclear. Amid this, George Kittle has opened up about his injury.

title: ‘Facing death threats, being punished for doing our job’: Bangladesh journos
content: Bangladeshi journalists face grave threats, including arson attacks on media offices and personal surveillance, ahead of the 2026 elections. Despite promises of safety, reporters feel unprotected, with no arrests made following the torching of Prothom Alo and The Daily Star. This escalating crisis signals a dangerous erosion of press freedom.

title: Tribal pushback over 'illegal settlers' kills 2 in Assam's West Karbi Anglong
content: Two people died and dozens of police officers were injured in violent tribal protests in Assam's West Karbi Anglong district. Demonstrators, armed with bows and crude bombs, clashed with security forces over alleged illegal non-tribal settlements on protected lands. Internet services were suspended as authorities vowed legal action against those involved.

title: Man kills 8 month pregnant wife in drunken rage
content: A Ludhiana man, Vijay Kumar, has been arrested for allegedly beating his eight-month pregnant wife, Pushpa, to death during a drunken rage. Her brother filed a complaint after Vijay attempted to claim she died of natural causes, despite visible injuries. Police suspect Pushpa fought back before succumbing to the assault.

title: NTA to roll out live photo, facial recognition checks
content: From 2026, the NTA will implement facial recognition for NEET-UG and JEE-Main to combat impersonation, following a successful pilot with Aadhaar-based authentication.  This, along with mandatory live photo capture during application, aims to bolster exam integrity amid recent leak concerns.  These enhanced security measures were recommended by a government committee.

title: Madhya Pradesh electoral rolls cut by over 42.7 lakh after SIR, 8.4 lakh voters 'unmapped'
content: Madhya Pradesh has removed 42.7 lakh voters, 7.4% of its electorate, in a massive electoral roll clean-up. This extensive revision, involving door-to-door verification, aimed to ensure accuracy by deleting deceased, shifted, and duplicate entries. The process also identified 'unmapped' voters requiring further documentation.

title: 'USS Defiant': Can 'Trump-class' warships deter China or just drain Pentagon?
content: President Trump unveiled plans for "Trump-class" warships, colossal missile-heavy vessels intended to form a "Golden Fleet" for the US Navy.  These massive ships aim to counter China's growing naval power and revive American shipbuilding. However, the ambitious project faces significant challenges including industrial capacity issues and questions about the relevance of such large vessels in modern warfare.

title: Fake suicide video, mentions of Trump: Largest set of Epstein documents released; new revelations
content: The DOJ released nearly 30,000 pages of Jeffrey Epstein files, including FBI interviews, victim accounts, Ghislaine Maxwell emails, and flight records involving Donald Trump. The documents detail Epstein’s abuse, grooming practices, and victims’ trauma, while alleging Maxwell’s lack of remorse. They also include an alleged fake suicide video and a letter to Larry Nassar referencing Trump. Epstein’s 2008 plea deal and 2019 death are also highlighted in the files.

title: Two dates, three traps: How to fix your NPS, PAN and ITR before December 31
content: December brings crucial financial deadlines. Ensure your NPS Scheme A is switched by the 25th to avoid unwanted changes. The 31st marks the final chance for belated or revised tax returns, crucial for carrying forward losses. Also, verify Aadhaar-PAN compliance for specific PAN holders to prevent inoperability. These actions prevent future financial headaches.

title: 'Finish him off': How UP bizman was killed, chopped, dumped by wife & lover; cops trace body parts
content: A Sambhal shoe trader was allegedly murdered, dismembered, and dumped by his wife and her lover after being caught in a compromising position. The wife confessed to the crime, detailing how they used an iron rod and shoe-hammer to kill him before dismembering the body and disposing of the parts.

title: Is Giannis Antetokounmpo playing tonight vs Pacers? Latest Bucks update
content: Milwaukee's superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo is out for tonight's game against the Indiana Pacers due to a calf strain. This absence, coupled with Indiana's own significant injury list including Tyrese Haliburton, leaves both struggling teams facing a depleted matchup. The game's outcome will likely hinge on which roster can manage the night despite key players being sidelined.

title: India-NZ deal to boost payment interoperability
content: India and New Zealand have agreed to collaborate on domestic payments interoperability and real-time cross-border remittances through integrated Fast Payment Systems. This pact strengthens India's digital payments ecosystem and fintech sector, while also enhancing FDI limits in banking and insurance for Indian financial service providers looking to expand into New Zealand.

title: 'Why do you object when India targets you': Pakistan cleric slams Munir's army— watch
content: JUI-F chief Maulana Fazlur Rehman stated Pakistan should not oppose Indian attacks if it attacks Afghanistan, questioning the double standard. He emphasized dialogue and political engagement as solutions to regional instability and asserted that political power belongs to the people, not the army..

title: Gabrielle Union opens up on surrogacy shame and desire to be pregnant publicly
content: Dwyane Wade, the NBA legend, and his wife, Gabrielle Union, went through a series of miscarriages as the popular actress tried to get pregnant. Nothing was working out for the couple at one point and Gabrielle Union opened up about how she felt for not being able to carry a child publicly.

title: Rohit returns to domestic cricket: Is Jaipur ready? VHT set to get underway
content: Jaipur will witness rare domestic cricket buzz as the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025–26 begins with Elite Group C matches at the SMS Stadium. Mumbai’s opener will feature Rohit Sharma, drawing big crowds. Following the BCCI mandate, his participation has boosted interest, prompting the Rajasthan Cricket Association to strengthen security and improve stadium facilities for fans.

title: Epstein files: Trump's name appears in latest file drop; listed as passenger on 8 private jet flights
content: Newly released DOJ records include an internal email stating that Donald Trump was listed as a passenger on at least eight flights aboard Jeffrey Epstein’s private jet between 1993 and 1996. The email, written by an assistant US attorney, details occasions when Ghislaine Maxwell and members of Trump’s family were also listed as passengers, while noting specific flights involving Epstein and potential witnesses. The disclosure is part of a broader release of thousands of Epstein-related documents.

title: Throwback: When Dhoni began his Indian cricket journey — with a golden duck
content: MS Dhoni made his international debut on this day in 2004 against Bangladesh, beginning a journey that would transform Indian cricket. Though run out for a duck on debut, his calm, skill and resilience stood out. A match-winning 148 against Pakistan soon followed, launching a legendary career built on leadership, trophies and unmatched composure.

title: From ‘great friend Modi’ to 50% tariffs: Decoding India–US ties in the Trump era
content: India-US relations are currently characterized by unpredictable fluctuations, driven by transactional politics and personal ego, particularly under President Trump's administration. Despite past bonhomie, trade wars and differing stances on global conflicts have strained ties, creating a complex dynamic between strategic imperatives and political unease.

title: Are chia seeds more effective for weight loss in water or in milk
content: Chia seeds, a kitchen staple, offer varied weight management benefits depending on preparation. Soaked in water, they aid appetite control with minimal calories. Mixed with milk, they become a more substantial, nutrient-rich meal replacement. Understanding these differences helps tailor chia seed consumption for individual weight loss goals, impacting digestion and energy levels.

title: How Indian States are following a pro-incumbency trend
content: Examples from around the world indicate how structural pressures, economic strain, social churn, and an anti-elite sentiment are producing different electoral logics.  But in India’s States, governments have got re-elected, often through welfare-driven incumbencies

title: Internet suspended in Assam’s Karbi Anglong, West Karbi Anglong amid unrest
content: The notification stated that the Government of Assam received reports from the District Magistrates of Karbi Anglong and West Karbi Anglong on December 23 of a serious "law and order" situation in two districts

title: Bengal Governor orders inquiry into firing of starter gun at marathon run in Kolkata
content: It also noted that minor splinters or particle-like fragments were emitted from the starter gun upon firing, but confirmed that no injury was caused to the Governor or anyone else present at the venue.

title: India tops global doping list for third consecutive year | Data
content: Global comparisons show that despite more rigorous testing regimes, the doping rate is much lower in many other countries

title: ‘Biggest fugitives’ Lalit Modi, Vijay Mallya captured on London party video
content: “We are the two fugitives, the biggest fugitives of India,” Lalit Modi, the founding commissioner of the Indian Premier League (IPL), can be heard saying in the video.

title: The story of a struggle to have a memorial after Ambedkar in Chennai
content: During then Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi’s stint as CM of the State, he got an arts and science college in Vyasarpadi in north Chennai named after Ambedkar

title: How T.N. Seshan’s airport arrival led to standoff with Jayalalithaa and attack on a star hotel
content: In the morning on November 27, 1994, the then Chief Election Commissioner of India T.N. Seshan landed at Madras Airport from New Delhi. What should have been a routine arrival quickly turned into a standoff with Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa.

title: VP Radhakrishnan welcomes AI in school curricula, says India should take lead
content: Vice President C.P. Radhakrishnan said on Tuesday that artificial intelligence should be incorporated into school curricula, and that India should be striving to reach the top of the field

title: Vizag will become data centre hub and Amaravati quantum hub says Naidu
content: Chief Minister highlights Visakhapatnam’s strong subsea cable connectivity and digital infrastructure which are positioning it as a key node in the global data ecosystem; Tirupati is being developed as a Space City, while regions such as Anantapur and Kadapa will evolve into major electronics and aerospace hubs, he adds

title: Bombay HC directs Maharashtra govt to pay ₹50 lakh benefit to COVID duty staff’s family
content: The court invokes societal gratitude for frontline workers, calls for generous interpretation of schemes to provide tangible relief to families who suffered immense hardships during the pandemic

title: Record rise in admissions to private schools under RTE in U.P., says govt.
content: Over the last five years, the total number of students securing admission to private schools under the scheme has more than doubled, a statement said

title: Strict action for New Year violations; special drunk driving checks from Wednesday
content: Hyderabad CP says riders/motorists caught drunk will face vehicle seizure, a fine of ₹10,000, six-month jail term and even permanent cancellation of driving licences

title: Deepthy Mary Varghese voices displeasure over being overlooked for Mayor’s post
content: KPCC general secretary and two-time Corporation councillor questions selection process, alleges norms were bypassed as District Congress Committee announced candidates for split terms

title: J&K HC dismisses Mehbooba’s PIL on undertrials; says courts cannot serve as forums for electoral campaigns
content: The court said that the PIL was grounded in ambiguity and rested on incomplete, vague and unsubstantiated assertions. The jurisdiction of PIL could not be invoked based on generalised claims without naming affected persons, challenging specific orders or placing verifiable material on record

title: Bombay HC rejects bail pleas of four accused in Palghar lynching case, cites gravity of roles
content: The court said liberty “cannot be absolute in every situation”; directs CBI to complete probe swiftly as applicants remain in custody for over five years

title: Leh violence: 22 officials, including CRPF, Ladakh Police personnel, record statement before Judicial Commission
content: An official spokesman said the Commission has “already collected and examined the written proceedings and statements submitted earlier as part of the preliminary process”

title: Over 27 lakh voters deleted from Chhattisgarh draft roll after SIR
content: The release added that genuine voters can still be added back in electoral roll during the Claims and Objections phase

title: 95 lakh names deleted from rolls of three States, one UT
content: The voters whose names have been deleted can apply for re-inclusion. The electoral officers will take a final decision on the applications, and the final rolls will be issued on February 14

title: 22 CPI (Maoist) cadres surrender in Odisha
content: They carried collective bounty of ₹1.84 crore on their heads; Odisha Police say they will be given subsidised housing, health plans and other welfare provisions to facilitate their mainstreaming

title: BJP cries foul as police quell violence at Bangladeshi mission in Kolkata
content: Suvendu Adhikari said police violence proved that there is no difference between Mamata Banerjee’s government in Bengal and Mohammad Yunus’s government in Bangladesh

title: West Bengal govt. suppressing peaceful protests over violence against Hindus in Bangladesh: BJP
content: The attacks on the community in Bangladesh had deeply hurt and angered Hindus in India, prompting peaceful demonstrations in various parts of the country, BJP MP and spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi said

title: Gold price touches ₹1 lakh per sovereign, buyers feel the pinch
content: With the wedding season in full swing, families planning weddings are left in the lurch as gold jewellery remains an essential prerequisite for most Kerala brides

title: NCP-SP to contest Mumbai polls with MVA, says party
content: For the first time, NCP-SP has spoken about contesting the Mumbai polls as part of the MVA; till now, the Shiv Sena, NCP-SP, and Congress have been exploring other arrangements for the polls

title: Trade unions call for strike against new Labour Codes, rural work law on February 12
content: Ten CTUs, alleged that the changes in the laws are a multi-pronged attack on people’s rights; a national convention of workers, scheduled on January 9, will formally ratify the call to strike

title: Ilia Topuria divorce: Giorgina Uzcategui’s allegation that led to police involvement
content: Ilia Topuria’s ex-wife Giorgina Uzcategui filed a police complaint in Madrid on December 22 over alleged online threats linked to their divorce. Her legal team stressed the case is private and involves a child. No charges have been announced, and both sides remain cautious as legal proceedings continue behind closed doors.

title: India’s first anti-terror policy to be released soon
content: Digital radicalisation, the misuse of open borders, and conversion networks funded by foreign players are among the key issues being discussed in the run-up to the policy’s release

title: App that helps travellers locate nearby toilets launched in Kerala
content: The ‘Take a Break’ project launched through local bodies to address shortage of public toilets, particularly for women travellers

title: Five Pakistani police personnel killed in bombing, shooting attack
content: The Pakistani Taliban, known as Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP), an Islamist militant group, later claimed responsibility ​for the attack

title: A.P. government aiming at welfare schemes that lead to jobs, livelihoods: Kolusu
content: The government is also planning to hold a skill census to identify the skill gaps and accordingly provide necessary training for the State’s youth, says Minister

title: DMK has strength, ideology, and resolve to oppose authoritarian forces, says Stalin
content: At a Christmas event organised by the DMK in Perambur, the Chief Minister says the minority communities in the country are living in a sense of fear. He also lists the initiatives taken by his government for their welfare

title: Russian strike could collapse Chernobyl shelter: plant director
content: Kyiv has accused Russia of repeatedly targeting the facility, the site of a 1986 meltdown that is still the world’s worst ever nuclear disaster, since Moscow invaded in February 2022

title: Nepal woman recovering after heart transplant at Ernakulam GH
content: By performing its first-ever heart transplant, Ernakulam GH became the first district hospital in the government sector in the country to carry out the surgery, says the  authorities

title: Work to widen road atop Jawadhu Hills in Tiruvannamalai begins
content: Blinkers and LED streetlights will be avoided in the stretch to allow free movement of wild animals in the hills during night

title: Councillor, two others, booked for assaulting autorickshaw drivers in Vellore
content: Initial inquiry revealed that separate autorickshaw stands affiliated to the DMK and the VCK have been operating near the new bus terminus, off Chennai - Bengaluru Highway Road (NH48) near Katpadi bridge for the past few years

title: 42.7 lakh voters deleted from Madhya Pradesh draft roll after SIR
content: Of the 42.74 lakh, 8.46 lakh are dead, 31.51 lakh were absent or had migrated, and 2.77 lakh people were registered as voters in more than one place, the Election Commission said

title: Film chamber to stop distributing movies in theatres under KSFDC from January
content: The apex body of film organisations in the Malayalam film industry had earlier deferred its strike, announced from June 1, 2025, following an assurance from Minister for Culture Saji Cherian that the government would consider its demands

title: Low temperature and frost lead to loss for tea sector in Munnar
content: A large quantity of tea leaves have wilted owing to the frost. Once it melts, tender leaf buds dry up under the sun. Plucking then cannot be resumed for another three months, leading to substantial loss

title: Nitin Nabin calls Rahul Gandhi a part-time politician
content: After Bihar, the BJP will win West Bengal and Kerala as well, the newly elected party president said, adding that the BJP is a party in which any worker who works with honesty and determination could reach the top

title: Congress picks V.K. Minimol, Shiny Mathew for split mayoral term in Kochi Corpn.
content: The decision came as a major setback to two-time councillor and KPCC general secretary Deepthy Mary Varghese, who had been widely considered the frontrunner for Mayor’s post; Deputy Mayor’s post to be shared between Deepak Joy and K.V.P. Krishnakumar

title: Court awards life term for 13 in lynching of father-son duo in Murshidabad
content: On April 12, Harogobind Das and Chandan Das were hacked to death after being dragged out of their home at Jafrabad village in West Bengal when a protest against the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025 turned violent

title: Teachers, students under pressure due to new norms, say Navyaandhra association leaders
content: Frequent examinations have turned the process into a chaotic exercise creating undue pressure and also resulting in students developing a fear for exams, they claim

title: Rahul Gandhi’s leadership now being questioned within Congress and among allies: BJP
content: BJP spokesperson alleges Mr. Gandhi is making “anti-national” remarks abroad because he has nost the support of Congress insiders, allies from the CPI(M), NCP(SP), DMK, SP, TMC, and NC

title: Govt. to go in appeal against trial court verdict in actor rape case
content: Government has given its nod to file an appeal against the trial court judgment before Kerala High Court when the court reopens after Christmas vacation

title: Naidu unveils South India Rocketry Challenge–2026 poster
content: The initiative aimed at nurturing rocket-making skills among school and college students across the region

title: Centre asks States to hold special gram sabhas for awareness on VB-G RAM G
content: In letter to States and Union Territories, the Centre has asked that these meetings be held by December 26 with the active participation of workers, women, SC/ST households, and vulnerable groups

title: Nothing special about DCM’s Delhi visit, says Satish Jarkiholi
content: The Minister says he hopes the party high command will end the confusion about the change of leadership in the State

title: PODA piloted by Kerala Police focuses on corporate-led drug prevention
content: Survey reveals very high drug consumption among financially stable youth in the age group of 25-35 in Kerala

title: Telangana conducts first State-level mock exercise on floods and industrial disasters
content: Large-scale exercise organised in response to climate-related challenges, including sudden heavy rainfall and flash floods, as well as a series of industrial accidents in recent years

title: Koepka leaving LIV Golf, cites family reasons
content: Five-time major champion Brooks Koepka is stepping away from LIV Golf, effective immediately, his representatives said Tuesday.

title: Perryman loses appeal, to miss Chargers' final 2
content: Denzel Perryman's two-game suspension for "repeated violations of playing rules intended to protect the health and safety of players" was upheld by hearing officer Jordy Nelson on Tuesday.

title: QB Fields' season over with Jets future uncertain
content: The Jets are placing quarterback Justin Fields on season-ending injured reserve with a knee injury that has sidelined him the past three games.

title: Canadiens handle Bruins in Original 6 fight-fest
content: In a fight-filled game befitting the Original Six rivalry, the Boston Bruins fell to the Montreal Canadiens 6-2 Tuesday night at TD Garden, a rowdy affair that saw the struggling home team allow four third-period goals en route to a fourth straight loss.

title: Bolts' Herbert: Haven't forgotten '24 playoff flop
content: Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert acknowledged his four-interception performance in last season's playoff loss to the Texans has stayed with him, saying "you got to learn" from those losses.

title: USMNT's Richards stretchered off in Carabao Cup
content: Crystal Palace and United States defender Chris Richards was taken from the field on a stretcher during his team's Carabao Cup game against Arsenal on Tuesday.

title: Cowboys' Prescott won't sit, vows '26 turnaround
content: Quarterback Dak Prescott says he won't sit out the Cowboys' final two games and vows to do "whatever it takes" to lead a Dallas turnaround next season.

title: 💓 Venus Williams, Andrea Preti tie the knot
content: Williams and Preti became wife and husband over the weekend in Palm Beach, Florida, as part of a five-day celebration.

title: 'That's what we sign up for': Five tales -- and a few gripes -- from playing on Christmas
content: With NBA Christmas games on the horizon, stars and coaches share their stories and gripes about playing on the holiday.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus each team's rookie of the year
content: There was plenty of movement after a wild Week 16. We also looked at the best rookies from all 32 teams.

title: Tracking the NFL playoff picture: Updated chances to clinch open spots, win division titles
content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: Kiyan Anthony is stepping out of his dad's shadow -- and into his own spotlight
content: His decision to play for Syracuse felt like a coronation. Now, he's out to prove he's more than Carmelo's son.

title: Men's: UConn supplants Duke as fourth No. 1 seed
content: The Huskies return to the top line as Duke drops to a 2-seed after suffering its first loss of the season.

title: Women's: Louisville up, Tennessee down as the battle to host heats up
content: A decisive win over Tennessee put Louisville solidly inside the top 16 -- and dropped the Lady Vols to a 6-seed.

title: A 12-player blockbuster? Cy Young signings? Ranking the biggest MLB Christmas week moves
content: Who says the baseball offseason slows down for the holidays? Let's remember some free agent signings and trades.

title: Aggrieved fan index: The 10 fan bases in 2025 that have the right to be most frustrated
content: Who has reason for jeer this holiday season? We break down which teams' fans have the most reasons to be mad.

title: What's new heading into second season of TGL
content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

title: Why and when the WNBPA executive committee might vote to strike
content: How and when would the WNBPA executive committee vote to strike? What would that entail? What benefits would be lost?

title: Chelsea are using Strasbourg as a "farm team" -- is this the new blueprint for top clubs?
content: Strasbourg now exists as a training ground for Chelsea prospects, akin to baseball's farm system. Is this the future of European soccer?

title: Overreactions: Are Villa in the title race? Can Wolves avoid history?
content: Just before we hit the crowded festive fixtures, we have plenty to overreact to in the Premier League.

title: World Junior Championship guide: Top contenders, key players to watch
content: The tournament starts Thursday, with the best under-20 players in hockey. Here are gold medal favorites, players set to break out.

title: The NHL's best this week: Is Craig Berube on the hot seat in Toronto?
content: As the holiday break approaches, the Maple Leafs aren't exactly excelling. Plus, key games in the week ahead.

title: Buzz: Purdy, McCaffrey and Kittle deliver big 'Monday Night Football' performances
content: Brock Purdy and Christian McCaffrey deliver top-10 scores for the week, Kittle the top tight end but leaves early.

title: Free agent pickups: Load up on Jaguars
content: All of the free agent options worth adding as we dive into Week 17 and the fantasy football championships.

title: Bowl season best bets: How to beat the bad bets while still getting in on the fun
content: Bowl season could be the last chance to back some beloved underdogs -- here's how to do it with all the chaos.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The transfer window is set to open across Europe in January, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

title: No one likes Gunther, Austin Theory joins The Vision
content: WWE fans already were out on Gunther for retiring John Cena. Now it's clear his fellow wrestlers are, too.

title: Pickups: Raynaud, Landale among several quality center options
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Smog Engulfs Delhi-NCR As Air Quality Prevails In 'Very Poor'
content: A thick blanket of toxic smog engulfed the national capital on Wednesday morning, pushing air pollution levels into the "very poor" category.

title: No More H-1B Lottery, US Notifies New Process For Awarding Work Visas
content: The Donald Trump administration in the United States has announced that it is replacing its longstanding H-1B work visa lottery system with a new weighted approach that prioritises skilled, higher-paid foreign workers.

title: "Sports Has No Language": Delhi BJP Counsels Councillor After Language Row
content: The Delhi BJP on Tuesday summoned and reprimanded councillor Renu Chaudhary for her threatening remarks against an African football coach over not learning the Hindi language.

title: India's Rocket Launch With Heaviest-Ever Satellite Delayed To Avoid Collision
content: The ISRO has taken a cautious approach and decided to delay the launch of the Launch Vehicle Mark 3 M6 flight by 90 seconds.

title: When Do You Intend To Return To India? Bombay High Court Asks Vijay Mallya
content: The Bombay High Court asked fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya when he intends to return to India and told his counsel it would not hear his plea against the Fugitive Economic Offenders Act unless he first submits himself to the HC jurisdiction.

title: Australian State Passes Tougher Gun, Anti-Terror Laws After Sydney Shooting
content: Australia's most populous state passed sweeping new gun and anti-terror laws following the recent mass shooting on Bondi Beach, tightening firearm ownership, banning public display of terrorist symbols and strengthening police power to curb protests.

title: US Supreme Court Blocks Trump's National Guard Deployment In Chicago
content: The US Supreme Court dealt a blow to President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown on Tuesday by blocking his deployment of National Guard troops in Chicago.

title: "Closely Monitoring Situation": Himanta Sarma On Assam's Karbi Anglong Violence
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday stated that he is "closely monitoring" the situation in West Karbi Anglong after two people lost their lives during the violent protests in the region.

title: Libya's Army Chief Killed In Plane Crash In Turkey
content: Libya's prime minister said the chief of staff of the country's army was killed in an airplane accident in Turkey on Tuesday after he visited Ankara.

title: Over 24 Lakh Electors Removed From Draft Voter Lists In Kerala After SIR
content: Over 24.08 lakh electors were deleted from the voter lists in Kerala as the Election Commission of India (ECI) published the draft electoral roll on Tuesday after the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise in the state.

title: Gas Explosion At Pennsylvania Nursing Home Traps People Inside
content: A gas explosion at a nursing home just outside Philadelphia triggered a plume of black smoke and trapped people inside the building, authorities said.

title: "Hope They Will Listen": Pope Leo Calls For Global Truce On Christmas Day
content: Pope Leo XIV on Tuesday called for a global truce on Christmas Day, expressing "great sadness" that "apparently Russia rejected a request" for one.

title: "Will Not Bow Down To Any Pressure": Iran, US Spar Over Nuclear Talks At UN
content: The United States and Iran traded barbs at the United Nations Security Council on Tuesday over conditions for reviving nuclear talks, with the US saying it remains ready for direct negotiations and Iran rejecting Washington's terms.

title: Trump In New Epstein Files: Jet Flights To Mar-a-Lago Subpoena - 5 Takeaways
content: The newest US document dump on Jeffrey Epstein is sprawling, uneven and heavily redacted -- but tucked inside are moments that have sharpened scrutiny on President Donald Trump's long-acknowledged past association with the notorious sex offender.

title: Shehbaz Sharif's Dialogue Offer To Imran Khan's Party To Ease Tensions
content: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Tuesday offered talks to the opposition Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf to ease political tension in the country, days after the party founder Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi were sentenced to 17 years in jail each.

title: Court Rejects Plea To Drop Mehul Choksi's Fugitive Economic Offender Tag
content: A court here has rejected Mehul Choksi's application seeking to quash the proceedings to declare him a Fugitive Economic Offender' (FEO) in the Punjab National Bank (PNB) fraud case.

title: 'Don't Object To India Action If...' Pak Leader Slams Own Country Over Kabul
content: A Pakistani lawmaker has called out the hypocrisy of his country's leadership, drawing a parallel between Islamabad's military actions against Kabul and India's 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: "People Are Angry": Trump Says Epstein Files Are 'Ruining Reputations'
content: Donald Trump said he believed "people are very angry that pictures are being released" that connect them to notorious sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, days after the Justice Department released a new tranche of files tied to the late financier.

title: "Ask Rekha Gupta": AAP On Lt Governor's Pollution Letter To Arvind Kejriwal
content: As Delhi struggles with air pollution, a fresh political battle erupted on Tuesday after Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena sent a sharply worded letter to former Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal.

title: Woman's Body Found Wrapped In Plastic Bags, Blanket In Jaipur
content: The body of an unidentified woman was found stuffed in plastic sacks on the porch of a house in the Shastri Nagar area here on Tuesday morning, police said, adding that injury marks on her face pointed to murder.

title: 'Dadgummit': 49ers troll Philip Rivers, Colts after victory
content: the 49ers beat the Indianapolis Colts 48-27 on "Monday Night Football" Purdy is the first 49ers quarterback with five passing touchdowns during a game . Colt signal-caller Philip Rivers had 277 passing yards and two touchdowns .

title: LeBron vs. Dillon Brooks: 'Social media junkie' to 'Help the bear' and everything between
content: the los Angeles lakers and Phoenix Suns have split two matchups this season . the two have had their fair share of battles on the court, but all comes down to competition . leBron James and Dillon Brooks will meet again on tuesday in Phoenix .

title: Clayton Kershaw and wife welcome fifth baby, Chloe Peach
content: the former los Angeles Dodgers pitcher announced he will retire at the end of the 2025 season . he shared a post with his new daughter, Chloe Peach Kershaw, alongside his wife and four children . the three-time world series champion announced during an interview on the "Sunday Night Baseball" broadcast on June 15 .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
